      <td>
        <font color="#18BC9C"><i>What?</i></font> &nbsp; &nbsp;
      </td>
      <td>
        Twice a month on a Friday, we will have a Zoom seminar series with a few short presentations (12 minutes each)—followed by a happy hour! Every third meeting will be an all egg-timer session. <br><br> 
        Papers and videos **will not** be circulated. <br><br>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign="top">
      <td>
        <font color="#18BC9C"><i>Who?</i></font> &nbsp; &nbsp;
      </td>
      <td>
        We're targeting presenters who are graduate students going on the job market this year or next year (2020 or 2021), postdocs, and first-year assistant professors. We may adjust selection based upon supply. <br><br> 
        There will be no discussants, but we will provide a little time for questions after each paper. We will try and cluster papers by topic and try and get some senior people specializing in that area to dial in! <br><br>
        The organizers of *OSWEET* include <a href="https://econ.williams.edu/profile/saj2/" style="text-decoration: none">Sarah Jacobson</a>, Williams; <a href="htts://edrub.in" style="text-decoration:none">Ed Rubin</a>, U of Oregon; <a href="http://www-personal.umich.edu/~chausman/" style="text-decoration:none">Catie Hausman</a>, Michigan; <a href="https://dyson.cornell.edu/faculty-research/faculty/ao332/" style="text-decoration:none">Ariel Ortiz-Bobea</a>, Cornell; <a href="https://priceschool.usc.edu/people/antonio-m-bento/" style="text-decoration:none">Antonio Bento</a>, USC; and <a href="https://www.auffhammer.com/" style="text-decoration:none">Max Auffhammer</a>, UC Berkeley. <br><br>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign="top">
      <td>
        <font color="#18BC9C"><i>When?</i></font> &nbsp; &nbsp;
      </td>
      <td>
        Twice a month; see schedule below. <br><br>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign="top">
      <td>
        <font color="#18BC9C"><i>Where?</i></font> &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
      </td>
      <td>
        Zoom. We will send out a Zoom link to presenters and audience members. <br><br>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr valign="top">
      <td>
        <font color="#18BC9C"><i>More?</i></font> &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
      </td>
      <td>
        This workshop is a supportive and constructive environment to present research (but you still have to bring your own beer/coffee/snacks to happy hour). <br><br>
